definition:
An $n\times n$ matrix $A$ that contains an $s \times (n-s)$ zero
submatrix for some positive integer $s$ is said to be [*partly
decomposable*]{}. If no such submatrix exists then $A$ is said to be *it
fully indecomposable*. By convention, a $1 \times 1$ matrix is fully
indecomposable if it is nonzero. $A$ is [*nearly decomposable*]{} if it
fully indecomposable but whenever a nonzero entry is changed to 0 the
resulting matrix is partly decomposable.
